title: Child Tax Credit

table.body:
You could get Child Tax Credit for each child you're responsible for if they're: 

+ under 16 
+ under 20 and in approved education or training

You don't need to be working to claim Child Tax Credit.

You get [money](child-tax-credit/what-youll-get "Money you can get") for each child that qualifies and Child Tax Credit won't affect your Child Benefit. 

How much you get depends on your circumstances - you can use the [tax credit calculator](/tax-credits-calculator "Tax credits calculator") to work this out. 

^Only one household can get Child Tax Credit for a child.^
table.title: Overview

table.body:
You get a basic amount and extra (known as 'elements") on top of this. 

How much you get depends on things like your income and circumstances (eg if your child is disabled). 

The basic amount is up to £545 a year.

Elements | Yearly amount
- | - 
For each child | Up to £2,690
For each disabled child | Up to £2,950
For each severely disabled child | Up to £1,190 (on top of the disabled child payment) 

%Use the [tax credit calculator](/tax-credits-calculator "tax credit calculator") to work out how much you can get.%

##How you’re paid

All benefits, pensions and allowances are paid [into an account](/how-to-have-your-benefits-paid "How to have your benefits paid") (eg a bank account) of the person mainly responsible for the child.

You're paid from the date of your claim up to the end of the tax year (5 April). 

##If your circumstances change 

Your tax credits you get can go up or down if your family or work life change - you must [report these changes](/changes-that-affect-your-tax-credits "Changes that affect your tax credits") to the Tax Credit Office. For example, your income changes by more than £2,500 or your child leaves home.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
Eligibility depends on:

+ the child's age 
+ your income 
+ if you're responsible for the child 

%Use the [tax credit questionnaire](/qualify-tax-credits-quick-questionnaire "Tax credit questionnaire") to check if you qualify.%

##The child's age

To qualify the child must be:

+ under 16 - you can claim up until the 31st August after their 16th birthday
+ under 20 - if they’re in approved education or training

##Your income

There's no set limit for income because it depends on your circumstances (and those of your partner). For example, it's sometimes £26,000 for a 1 child family but can be higher if you pay for [approved childcare](/childcare-tax-credits "Childcare and tax credits") or one of you is disabled. 

%Use the [tax credit calculator](/tax-credits-calculator "Tax credit calculator") to check if your income is too high for tax credits.% 

##Responsibility for a child 

You're usually responsible for a child if they: 

+ live with you all the time
+ they normally live with you and you're the main carer
+ they live in Europe but are financially dependent on you

Contact the Tax Credit Helpline if you're not sure you're responsible for the child. 

$C
**Tax Credit Helpline**  
**Telephone:** 0345 300 3900  
**Textphone:** 0345 300 3909
$C

##If the child is disabled

You may get extra Child Tax Credits if:

- the child gets Disability Living Allowance
- the child is registered blind (or was within 28 weeks of your tax credits claim)

You still qualify if Disability Living Allowance stops because the child goes into hospital.
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
If you're new to tax credits, contact the Tax Credit Helpline for a claim form. It takes up to 2 weeks to arrive. 

If you’re already claiming tax credits you don't need a claim form - just call the helpline to update your claim.

$C
**Tax Credit Helpline**  
**Telephone:** 0345 300 3900  
**Textphone:** 0345 300 3909
$C

##What you need to know

Only one household can get Child Tax Credit for a child. 

You can claim at any time of the year and apply for Child and Working Tax Credits on the same claim form. 

You have to [renew your claim](/renewing-your-tax-credits-claim "Renew your tax credits") once a year. 

To support your claim, keep records about your income, bills, payslips, benefits, tax credits, child care and your child’s education.
